instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..
definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> battery- symbol
threads.message:
Hi. I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with liquid damaged. For the most it was minor and cleaned up relatively well. Now the issue is the battery icon has an x when logged in. System report says 0 cycles and service recommended. Fan speed is normal. 
Im still pretty new to m1 stuff so here is what i know so far-
Battery connected 
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON</SIGNAL> - 11.6v
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON_CHARGER_REG</SIGNAL> -12.01 v
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON_CHGR_R</SIGNAL> - 12.01v
Sys detect - 3.3v
<SIGNAL>I2C_SMC_PWR_3V3_SCL</SIGNAL>-2.2v
<SIGNAL>I2C_SMC_PWR_3V3_SDA</SIGNAL>-3.1c

When battery was disconnected i checked <SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL> and it was 12.01v

So there was liquid damage on j5151 on pin 2 and 7 and then had detached. I solder them back and some liquid near <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> so cleaned that and checked for any shorts. None detected.
Also diode mode to ground on <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> and it was 0.404. 

What should i do next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> battery- symbol
threads.message:
Check if <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> has 0V; charger and battery connected.
If yes, check diode mode to ground and voltage on all SCL/SDA lines of UD200/1.
Be sure to have good continuity between UD201 and battery connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> battery- symbol
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> -0v
Diode mode red probe on ground
<SIGNAL>I2C_SMC_PWR_SDA</SIGNAL> - 0.335
<SIGNAL>I2C_SMC_PWR_SCL</SIGNAL> - 0.333
<SIGNAL>I2C_SMC_PWR_1V8_SDA</SIGNAL> - 0.561
<SIGNAL>I2C_SMC_PWR_1V8_SCL</SIGNAL> - 0.568
<SIGNAL>I2C_SMC_PWR_3V3_SDA</SIGNAL> - 0.639
<SIGNAL>I2C_SMC_PWR_3V3_SCL</SIGNAL> - 0.648

continuity seems ok

volatges - 
<SIGNAL>I2C_SMC_PWR_SDA</SIGNAL> - 1.3v
<SIGNAL>I2C_SMC_PWR_SCL</SIGNAL> - 1.3v
<SIGNAL>I2C_SMC_PWR_1V8_SDA</SIGNAL> - 1.79v
<SIGNAL>I2C_SMC_PWR_1V8_SCL</SIGNAL> - 1.79v
<SIGNAL>I2C_SMC_PWR_3V3_SDA</SIGNAL> - 3.1v
<SIGNAL>I2C_SMC_PWR_3V3_SCL</SIGNAL> - 2.0v doesnt look ok
<SIGNAL>UD201_EN</SIGNAL> - 1.9v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> battery- symbol
threads.message:
Check RD207.
If good, replace UD201.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> battery- symbol
threads.message: Rd207 is 6.7k ohms. I believe its meant to be 4.7k. Also rd208 is also 6.7k. Im going to replace ud201 anyway. Will keep you posted

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> battery- symbol
threads.message:
Replaced ud201 and ud5150 on a whim from a post i read earlier. Battery is detected now and charges.

I am not sure which component replacement fixed it but i would like to believe its ud5150
<SIGNAL>I2C_SMC_PWR_3V3_SDA</SIGNAL> - 3.2v
<SIGNAL>I2C_SMC_PWR_3V3_SCL</SIGNAL> -3.2v

This was after i replaced both components.
Thanks for the help.
